abstract: Mr. Hevesi’s plea makes him the highest-ranking state official convicted in the case involving kickbacks to allies in exchange for access to New York’s $125 billion pension fund.
snippet: Mr. Hevesi’s plea makes him the highest-ranking state official convicted in the case involving kickbacks to allies in exchange for access to New York’s $125 billion pension fund.
lead_paragraph: 12:52 p.m. | Updated Former State Comptroller Alan G. Hevesi pleaded guilty on Thursday to steering millions of dollars in state pension money to an investment firm in return for kickbacks that included travel and other expenses, and campaign funds, The New York Times’s William Rashbaum and Danny Hakim reported.
